message: I have a htc evo with sprint, it's awesome :)
Droid  x on verizon. quite the upgrade from my iphone 3g from at&t. love the freedom.
iPhone 4 on AT&T and love it!
iphone 4g AT&T i live in NYC and it works fine
similar question for iphone users jailbroken or not?
iPhone 4 on AT&T. I'm the only one who can say that.
@jarod73 I'm very happy with AT&T so I have no plans of switching.
ATT iPhone 4. No plan to switch network or OS.
Nope no need to jailbreak
have yall considered the iphone 4 on verizon or are you waiting to see what happens with the iphone 5
awesome! if it works why change! lol
droid x is awesome, is it rooted?
I'm in SF btw
Jailbroken iPhone 4 (love), AT&T (hate).
I have a dumbphone (Nokia Nuron) on T-Mobile. Will get @mistahsnart's Nexus One when he upgrades.
I'm an EVO user with Sprint. Most days I wonder how I lived without it O_o
Google/HTC Nexus One (rooted) on T-Mobile. Love my phone and service....but actually think I might be moving on in the coming months to a new phone. Possibly the LG Optimus 2x
I'm with @cym0n, Nexus One (stock 2.3.3) but upgrading to the LG Optimus 2x on T-Mobile as soon as it's out.
@jarod73 Nope, I'm with @spencer, no need to jailbreak.
lol awesome
at&t iPhone 4. Tried the Verizon iPhone 4, but Verizon service sucks at my house as bad as at&t, so I stuck with at&t.
For smart phone I'd go with Droid X, wouldn't mind using it to replace my gps too, but the 2 year economics don't make sense to me.

I got sick of Verizon billing. Went with Boost unlimited voice and text, exactly $50/mo. Actually it has unlimited internet too but sucks too much to use it. My phone was $50, no commitments. Every 6 months I keep the service, my bill goes down $5 (till $35).
@blogkitten what do you think about nokia working w/ microsoft to make a wp7 nokia
i think i pay around 70-80 a month for my 450 unlimited everything plan with sprint.. i like my evo even more so since i rooted it.. not sure what sprint has coming out that will top it

I dread the day my dad removes me from his plan I will have to get like capped Internet and hardly anytalk I wish iPhone was more open just so google voice could be integrated better LOL one day maybe
Nexus One/T-Mob. Considering I had a first gen HTC Magic, I'm in happy unicorn land.
@mikelewis Happy Unicorn Land is the happiest place :-D
iPhone 4 on AT&T
iPhone 4 on du (dubai) and Nokia N900 on all other service providers wherever I may roam ;)
as for liking it - I LOVE it ;) its the best piece of action I have since I got married :P ;) i get to touch it all the time and it wont complain :P having said that - unlimited data ROCKS
I may have to reconsider my statement after hearing the news of AT&T acquiring T-Mobile
(skype video works fine on iPhone 4 with 3 bars of signal in sf!)
Yay no more smug lady making false claims you can't video call cross AT&T!
Blackberry Bold on T-Mobile. Looks like we'll be moving to Verizon after our contract is up next year.
how are ya liking that blackberry?

For the most part, I love it. I started having some issues where it would freeze a lot. Upgraded the OS and it fixed those. Foursquare tends to have problems with the GPS location, but I can use Google Maps directions just fine, so it's not completely the fault of the BB itself.

Biggest complaint is that it can supposedly sync contacts with gmail, but it never works right - it ends up duplicating a lot of entries on both sides of the sync - and worse, mixes up information. John Doe may end up suddenly having Jane Smith's phone number attached to him.
All Android phones sync with Google Voice
I really hope iPhone and google voice get closer it us a big dream right now but whatever I can dream big LOL
I really like the seamless use of a google voice number on Droid. Is easy access to google voice/text available on other phones? Just Droid? Just Android?
@phntm42 i wonder if it's just that model... i had a curve once other than it being extremely slow it was a good phone.. have you done a reinstall to try and fix?
@jarod73 To fix the contact duplication? Any time I upgrade the OS or resync the contact list with google, it screws it all up again.
Looks like I jinxed myself. My phone has frozen twice today, requiring battery pulls to restart it.
@phntm42 my fiancee had to do some battery pulls the other day herself. Do you have the 9700? Have you thought or been tempted by the OS 6 leaks?
Htc evo that randomly reboots in the worst moments.Yesterday I was using it as my gps when it suddenly died for no reason and entered an endless rebooting loop)
@mikelewis Yup, the 9700. I've eyed the OS6 leaks, but haven't given it any real consideration. For the most part, OS5 has done me well enough so far.
@elg0nz it sounds like you may have a bad app or something.. have you tried removing odd apps or doing a factory data reset?
So, it looks like we'll be switching to Verizon next week. Now to decide iPhone 4 or an Android phone.
@phntm42 you're not looking into that Xperia Play? Not sure when that comes out here, but I hear it's coming out on Verizon.
http://androidandme.com/2011/03/carriers/a-closer-look-at-verizons-upcoming-onslaught-of-android-phones/

@jarod73 Thanks, I'll give this a thorough reading over lunch. Unfortunately, it looks like our carrier switchover will have to be late this week or early next week unless we want to go without cellphones. So, while great stuff may be right around the corner, they may be too far off for me to get a deal on.
@mikelewis I haven't seen anything that makes me really want it any more than any other Android phone. I'm not a big handheld gamer, and I'm fine with my DSi for when I do travel.
that happened to a buddy of mine, maybe you could pull a switch a phone w/in 30 days till they get the phone you want lol
